page.title: 14HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content:
On the Western edge of the block is a house known as "Goddards" which was built in l899 and extended in l9l0. The architect was the great Edwin Lutyens (who was 30 in l899). He was inspired by Stokesay Castle and The Prior's Lodge at Much Wenlock Priory (both in Shropshire),
A great deal of matured older material was used in the building - e.g. the traditional Horsham slabs for the roof, brought from Slinfold, together with two l7th Century barns from there and an old waggon house from Horsham Brewery.
The gardens were designed by Gertrude Jekyll - the sunken stone gardens were considered as part of the house. As
